verses.text: So they brought in the ark of God, and set it in the midst of the tabernacle which David pitched for it; and they offered whole burnt offerings and peace-offerings before God.
And David finished offering up whole burnt offerings and peace-offerings, and blessed the people in the name of the Lord.
And he divided to every man of Israel (both men and women), to \add every\add* man one baker's loaf, and a cake.
And he appointed before the ark of the covenant of the Lord, Levites to minister \add and\add* lift up the voice, and to give thanks and praise the Lord God of Israel:

Asaph \add was\add* the chief, and next to him Zacharias, Jeiel, Semiramoth, and Jeiel, Mattathias, Eliab, and Banaeas, and Abdedom: and Jeiel sounding with musical instruments, lutes \add and\add* harps, and Asaph with cymbals:
and Banaeas and Oziel the priests \add sounding\add* continually with trumpets before the ark of the covenant of God in that day.
Then David first gave orders to praise the Lord by the hand of Asaph and his brethren.
Song. Give thanks to the Lord, call upon him by his name, make known his designs among the people.
Sing \add songs\add* to him, and sing hymns to him, relate to all \add people\add* his wonderful deeds, which the Lord has wrought.
Praise his holy name, the heart that seeks his pleasure shall rejoice.
Seek the Lord and be strong, seek his face continually.
Remember his wonderful works which he has wrought, his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;
\add you⌃\add* seed of Israel his servants, \add you⌃\add* seed of Jacob his chosen ones.
He \add is\add* the Lord our God; his judgments \add are\add* in all the earth.
Let us remember his covenant for ever, his word which he commanded to a thousand generations,
which he covenanted with Abraham, and his oath \add sworn\add* to Isaac.
He confirmed it to Jacob for an ordinance, to Israel \add as\add* an everlasting covenant,
saying, To you will I give the land of Chanaan, the line of your inheritance:
when they were few in number, when they were but little, and lived as strangers in it;
and went from nation to nation, and from one kingdom to another people.
He suffered not a man to oppress them, and he reproved kings for their sakes,
saying, Touch not my anointed ones, and deal not wrongfully with my prophets.
Sing you⌃ to the Lord, all the earth; proclaim his salvation from day to day.
Declare among the nations his glory, his wondrous deeds among all peoples.
For the Lord \add is\add* great, and greatly to be praised: he \add is\add* to be feared above all gods.
For all the gods of the nations \add are\add* idols; but our God made the heavens.
Glory and praise \add are\add* in his presence; strength and rejoicing \add are\add* in his place.
Give to the Lord, you⌃ families of the nations, give to the Lord glory and strength.
Give to the Lord the glory \add belonging\add* to his name: take gifts and offer \add them\add* before him; and worship the Lord in his holy courts.
Let the whole earth fear before him; let the earth be established, and not be moved.
Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth exult; and let them say among the nations, The Lord reigns.
The sea with its fullness shall resound and the tree of the field, and all things in it.
Then shall the trees of the wood rejoice before the Lord, for he is come to judge the earth.
Give thanks to the Lord, for \add it is\add* good, for his mercy \add is\add* for ever.
And say you⌃, Save us, O God of our salvation, and gather us, and rescue us from among the heathen, that we may praise your holy name, and glory in your praises.
Blessed \add be\add* the Lord God of Israel from everlasting and to everlasting: And all the people shall say, Amen. So they praised the Lord.
And they left there Asaph and his brethren before the ark of the covenant of the Lord, to minister before the ark continually, according to the service of each day: from day to day.
And Abdedom and his brethren \add were\add* sixty and eight; and Abdedom the son of Idithun, and Osa, \add were\add* to be doorkeepers.
And \add they appointed\add* Sadoc the priest, and his brethren the priests, before the tabernacle of the Lord in the high place in Gabaon,
to offer up whole burnt offerings continually morning and evening, and according to all things written in the law of the Lord, which he commanded the children of Israel by Moses the servant of God.
And with him \add were\add* Aeman and Idithun, and the rest chosen out by name to praise the Lord, for his mercy \add endures\add* for ever.
And with them \add there were\add* trumpets and cymbals to sound aloud, and musical instruments for the songs of God: and the sons of Idithun \add were\add* at the gate.
And all the people went every one to his home: and David returned to bless his house.
